data.name: Label1.Text
data.value:
Use this form on one or several securities to see how price behaves over time.
Shown is a run using Apple stock. I wanted to know the best time of the year where price is most likely to rise at least 100% in 261 price bars (5 bars = 1 week, 261 bars = 1 year, including holidays).
Green shaded cells have the highest number of outliers (unusally high number of matches). Red shaded cells have unusually low number of matches. The Outlier Totals at table bottom shows a count of green outliers.
1. Results are shown in the grid. 2. Enter a number from 1 to 1000 (in percent). 3. Enter a number from 1 to 261 (1 year) in price bars. 4. Select a close-to-close or low to high price measure to calculate the percentage rise. 5. If you wish to use selected dates, then check this box and change the From and To dates accordingly.
Click Start to begin the analysis, Stop to interrupt a run, and Clipboard to copy all grid cells to the clipboard.
